I've done some simple back of the envelope math for what CV could end up looking like under a worst case scenario. Using the 1918 pandemic for a basis to compare to. It goes like this :

The 1918 Pandemic saw 500 million infected, 50 million dead, with a total global population of about 2 billion.
That's 25% infected, with 10% fatality rate.
The 1918 Flu had an R0 value of about 1, and this CV is estimated to be about 2.
Today, the global population is about 8 billion. With a higher R0 value, expect a higher percentage of the population to become infected compared to 1918.
So if R0 = 2, then 50% would become infected. I'll use a 40%-60% range since we haven't had enough time to really establish the true numbers.
With an estimated fatality rate of 3% that comes to about 100 million - 150 million dead before this thing is over with.

That is worst case scenario. There isn't a historic model to compare to with widespread social distancing, since it hasn't really been applied on a large scale ever before. On a smaller scale in 1918 isolation did reduce infection rate. But that was with a virus that was less infectious than CV. In the past pandemics really only end one way. That is through herd immunity. The recovered people need to make up enough percentage of the global population to provide herd immunity. It doesn't look like a vaccine will be available in time. Even if it is, it has to be distributed to most of the people on the planet to provide the same herd immunity.

I live in Marysville Washington, a little north of where the first case in the US was. The disease has been spreading for weeks now and officials have been ignoring it completely. The school systems have completely mixed responses. In class there are multiple kids i see who are obviously sick, coughing sneezing or etc. and they are not sent home. My particular district, in their infinite wisdom has reacted the worst where some schools have canceled because of a student who tested positive for the disease, that school in which hundreds of students from other schools travel to everyday. They decided that the best course of action was not to cancel, but disinfect the schools, and then continue as if nothing has happened.

The worst part of it though, is the people and the idiocy. The young people are not taking any precautions because they believe they are immune and won’t be hurt, or they are being overly cautious which doesn’t hurt but overwhelming smell of hand sanitizer. The stores are all bought out of supplies for when we have to stay at home for who knows how long because false information is spreading like wildfire. Shitty websites and facebook are spreading lies and mistruths and it’s actually causing panic and could cause harm.

The scariest thing is that no one really knows what is going on if you are sick, and that you go to containment for a while. But what does that do to us? We don’t get compensation for that time lost from work, that could be devastating for a lot of families, and people are actually telling others NOT to tell anyone if they’re sick. The scariest thing about all of this is not the virus, it’s the reaction of the public and the underwhelming response from the people who are supposed to be able to handle this kind of shit. I also don’t know a whole lot about the CDC but what kind of crap are they pulling? We only now got testing available, but only 1000 a day, and there are absolutely way more infected than that. I commend you on this video. Well done and easy to understand. However, there is another pandemic which you could help to curb: the use of the world "actually". I counted 8 instances of the use of this word in this video - none of which were necessary. Five of these were in the first 3 minutes. It is distracting. In addition, by inserting "actually" into a sentence, you are claiming that what you are saying is true, but at the same time - whether you intend to or not - you cast doubt on all of the information in sentences that do not contain the word. "Actually" seems to be a verbal tic among many, and its use is spreading like wildfire. Your point could be made with more clarity without it.

1:09 "contracted COVID-19?"
You contract THE VIRUS and sometimes develop THE DISEASE... much like HIV versus AIDS. The ICTV is the naming authority and since they named the virus SARS-CoV-2 the WHO named the disease COVID-19. This is why the 3.4% mortality rate only considers severe cases (AKA, people with the DISEASE and not just the virus). Just like influenza, there are people walking around who test positive for the virus but show no sign of the disease. Those people are likely to claim that they "never get sick" and few would ever say "I tested positive for the flu" to mean that they were sickened by it.

This isn't to downplay it by comparing to the flu as many other do... If you were notably sickened by 2019 H1N1 Pandemic Influenza ("Swine Flu") and you were notably sickened by SARS-CoV-2 with COVID-19 then your chances against this new virus are significantly worse.
